subsheet.name: Deleting a Configuration with a queue associated
Deleting a configuration with no queue associated

input.name: New Password
input.narrative: If this is your first login it will prompt you to change the password.

input.name: pid
input.narrative: PID to attach to

input.name: Tab Name
input.narrative: Name of Tab to Click

stage.name: Set start time to collect data between
Set end time to collect data between

input.name: Configuration name
input.narrative: This is the configuration name that is to be entered for the snapshot

input.name: Set snapshot interval
input.narrative: This is the interval when each snapshot will be taken at

input.name: Time zone
input.narrative: This is the time zone that user needs to set for the snapshot

input.name: Start time
input.narrative: The time that you want the snapshot to start from
input.expr: [Set start time to collect data between]

input.name: End time
input.narrative: The time that you want the snapshot to finish
input.expr: [Set end time to collect data between]

input.name: Collection day
input.narrative: This is the collection of days on which the snapshot should be taken

input.name: Configuration enabled?
input.narrative: This is the flag to set whether user wants to enable the snapshot configuration or not. It is set to false by default

resource.action: Queue Snapshots - Set Configuration Enabled State

stage.name: Click ok to save snapshot configuration

input.name: Duplicate error expected?
input.narrative: Do you expect an error message when pressing ok button from the snapshot configuration form

input.name: Edit config warning expected?
input.narrative: Do you expect a warning message to be shown when editing an existing snapshot configuration to alter some values and clicking ok? (This would only happen if the existing config had 'configuration enabled' enabled

input.name: Editing config - trend data warning option
input.friendlyname: Editing config - trend data warning option
input.narrative: Select 'yes' or 'no' to continue editing config once trend data warning has been displayed

output.name: Error Message
output.narrative: This is the error message content that is displayed when clicking ok on a snapshot configuration that has a duplicate name of an existing one

output.name: Trend data warning message
output.narrative: This is the warning message content that is displayed when clicking ok on a snapshot configuration that has been edited and it was previously enabled to a queue and had its configuration enabled set to true

stage.name: Toggle queue to configure with this snapshot

input.name: Queue Name
input.narrative: This is the name of the queue which you wish to be enabled to the snapshot configuration

resource.action: Queue Snapshots - Toggle Snapshot Queue Selection

exception.detail: "Config name does not match what was entered"
"Snapshot interval value does not match what was entered"

decision.expression: [Collection end time value]=[Set end time to collect data between]

exception.detail: "Collection end time does not match what was entered"

input.name: Snapshot Name
input.narrative: The name of the snapshot you want to select.

output.name: Config name value
output.narrative: This is the value read from the configuration name field

output.name: Time zone value
output.narrative: This is the value read from the time zone drop down field

output.name: Collection start time value
output.narrative: This is the value read from the collection start time field

output.name: Collection end time value
output.narrative: This is the value read from the collection end time field

output.name: Snapshot interval value
output.narrative: This is the value read from the snapshot interval drop down field

output.name: Queues enabled
output.narrative: This is the value read from the snaphot form that tell us which work queues have been enabled to this snapshot

output.name: Days of collection
output.narrative: This is the value read from which days the snapshot will be collected on

stage.name: Note2
stage.narrative: GIVEN I can create a work queue analysis snapshop configuration

input.name: State
input.narrative: This allows user to set the checkbox for whether the snapshot should be taken on specific days or not. It is unticked by default

resource.action: Queue Snapshots - Set Specific Days CheckBox

input.name: State
input.narrative: The state you want to set for the specific time checkbox.It is set to false by default

resource.action: Queue Snapshots - Set Specific Time Checkbox

exception.detail: "Time zone value does not match what was entered"

decision.expression: [Collection start time value]=[Set start time to collect data between]

exception.detail: "Collection start time value does not match what was entered"

field.name: Day
field.description: This is the day you wish to select

field.name: State
field.description: This indicates whether you want the days selected to be ticked or unticked

stage.name: Click ok to save snapshot configuration

input.name: Duplicate error expected?
input.narrative: Do you expect an error message when pressing ok button from the snapshot configuration form

input.name: Edit config warning expected?
input.narrative: Do you expect a warning message to be shown when editing an existing snapshot configuration to alter some values and clicking ok? (This would only happen if the existing config had 'configuration enabled' enabled

input.name: Editing config - trend data warning option
input.friendlyname: Editing config - trend data warning option
input.narrative: Select 'yes' or 'no' to continue editing config once trend data warning has been displayed

output.name: Error Message
output.narrative: This is the error message content that is displayed when clicking ok on a snapshot configuration that has a duplicate name of an existing one

output.name: Trend data warning message
output.narrative: This is the warning message content that is displayed when clicking ok on a snapshot configuration that has been edited and it was previously enabled to a queue and had its configuration enabled set to true

stage.name: Go to Reporting - Work Queue Snapshots

input.name: Tree Name
input.narrative: Name of the tree to be extended.

input.name: Item Name
input.narrative: Name of the item to be clicked on.

input.name: Sub Item Name
input.narrative: Name of the sub item to be clicked on.

input.name: Select Item Method?
input.narrative: True by Default. Selects the node from system tab using Select Item approach. If the node is not available (Greyed out) an exception will be thrown. Use this method if you are certain the node is available for selection.

input.name: Retry MouseClick?
input.narrative: Default to True. Retries Global Mouse Click up to 3 times.

input.name: Clean Up?
input.narrative: False by Default. Set True if clean up is required at the beginning of the Action.

input.name: Tree Name
input.narrative: Name of the tree to be extended.

input.name: Item Name
input.narrative: Name of the item to be clicked on.

input.name: Sub Item Name
input.narrative: Name of the sub item to be clicked on.

input.name: Select Item Method?
input.narrative: True by Default. Selects the node from system tab using Select Item approach. If the node is not available (Greyed out) an exception will be thrown. Use this method if you are certain the node is available for selection.

input.name: Retry MouseClick?
input.narrative: Default to True. Retries Global Mouse Click up to 3 times.

input.name: Clean Up?
input.narrative: False by Default. Set True if clean up is required at the beginning of the Action.

input.name: Name
input.narrative: The name of the work queue

input.name: Key Field
input.narrative: The key field for the work queue

input.name: Active
input.narrative: Flag indicating if the work queue should be made active or not - default is True, ie. Active

input.name: Max Attempts
input.narrative: The maximum number of attempts to allow on this queue

input.name: Set Encryption?
input.narrative: This is a flag to tick the encryption tickbox for a queue.

input.name: Scheme Name
input.narrative: This is the name of the scheme in which you wish to encrypt the queue with.

input.name: Set Active Queue
input.narrative: True or False, do you want to make this an active queue.

input.name: Assigned Process
input.narrative: The name of the proccess you wish to assign to the active queue.

input.name: Assigned Resource Group
input.narrative: The name of the resoruce group you want to assign to the active queue.

stage.name: Note2
stage.narrative: WHEN I create a configuration with specifc settings THEN the setting are preserved upon saving

stage.name: Deleting a Configuration with a queue associated
stage.narrative: A user will not be able to delete a snapshot configuration that is currently configured to a work queue

input.name: Snapshot Name
input.narrative: The name of the snapshot you want to select.

input.name: Delete configuration confirmation option
input.narrative: This is the window that pops up to ask user to confirm if they want to delete the snapshot

input.name: Error message
input.narrative: This is the error message received if trying to delete a snapshot that is already enabled to a work queue

output.name: Delete error message displayed
output.narrative: This is the error message received if trying to delete a snapshot that is already enabled to a work queue

output.name: Delete confirmation message displayed
output.narrative: This is the confirmation message displayed when user tries to delete a snapshot that is not currently enabled to any work queues

decision.expression: InStr([Delete error message displayed], "Unable to delete snapshot configuration as it is applied to the following work queues;")<>0

exception.detail: "You expected an error when deleting, either there was no error, or the error was incorrect."

stage.name: Deleting a configuration with no queue associated
stage.narrative: User will be able to delete a snapshot configuration if no work queue is configured to it

input.name: Snapshot Name
input.narrative: The name of the snapshot you want to select.

input.name: Delete configuration confirmation option
input.narrative: This is the window that pops up to ask user to confirm if they want to delete the snapshot

input.name: Error message
input.narrative: This is the error message received if trying to delete a snapshot that is already enabled to a work queue

output.name: Delete error message displayed
output.narrative: This is the error message received if trying to delete a snapshot that is already enabled to a work queue

output.name: Delete confirmation message displayed
output.narrative: This is the confirmation message displayed when user tries to delete a snapshot that is not currently enabled to any work queues

stage.name: Note2
stage.narrative: WHEN I try and delete a configuration that has a queue associated with it THEN the configuration isn't deleted and an error is displayed

stage.name: Deleting a Configuration with a queue associated
Note2
stage.narrative: WHEN I try and delete a configuration with no queue associated with it THEN the configuration is successfuly deleted

stage.name: Deleting a configuration with no queue associated
Toggle queue to configure with this snapshot

input.name: Queue Name
input.narrative: This is the name of the queue which you wish to be enabled to the snapshot configuration

resource.action: Queue Snapshots - Toggle Snapshot Queue Selection

stage.name: Click ok to save snapshot configuration

input.name: Edit config warning expected?
input.narrative: Do you expect a warning message to be shown when editing an existing snapshot configuration to alter some values and clicking ok? (This would only happen if the existing config had 'configuration enabled' enabled

input.name: Editing config - trend data warning option
input.friendlyname: Editing config - trend data warning option
input.narrative: Select 'yes' or 'no' to continue editing config once trend data warning has been displayed

output.narrative: This is the error message content that is displayed when clicking ok on a snapshot configuration that has a duplicate name of an existing one

output.name: Trend data warning message

input.narrative: The name of the snapshot you want to select.

input.name: Name
input.narrative: The name of the work queue

input.name: Key Field
input.narrative: The key field for the work queue

input.name: Active
input.narrative: Flag indicating if the work queue should be made active or not - default is True, ie. Active

input.name: Max Attempts
input.narrative: The maximum number of attempts to allow on this queue

input.name: Set Encryption?
input.narrative: This is a flag to tick the encryption tickbox for a queue.

input.name: Scheme Name
input.narrative: This is the name of the scheme in which you wish to encrypt the queue with.

input.narrative: True or False, do you want to make this an active queue.

field.name: Item Name
field.description: The name of the item that needs cleaning up.

decision.expression: [Set collection day.Day]=[Days of collection.Day] AND [Set collection day.State]=[Days of collection.Checked?]

exception.detail: "One of the days to collect data was set incorrectly."

decision.expression: [Expected Queue Values.Queue Name]=[Queues enabled.Queue Name] AND [Expected Queue Values.State]=[Queues enabled.Checked?]

exception.detail: "One of the queues was set incorrectly."
